name: Nine to Five Quiz | Movies | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who sings the theme song to the movie?
questions.explanation:
Dolly Parton & Parton & Dolly.

	I have always enjoyed Dolly Parton's songs.

questions.text: What time did the all the alarm clocks buzz at the beginning of the movie?
What was the name of the company the three women worked for?
questions.explanation: Consolidated.

questions.text: What was Dolly Parton's character's name?
questions.explanation:
Doralee Rhodes.

	Parton was Truvy Jones in 'Steel Magnolias', Mona Stangley in 'The Best Little Whorehouse In Texas', and Shirlee Kenyon in 'Straight Talk'.

questions.text: What did Judy (Jane Fonda) have extreme trouble doing on her first day on the job?
questions.explanation:
Operating the Xerox machine.

	Judy ended up falling in love and getting married to the Xerox representative, according to the closing credits.

questions.text: What was Judy's ex-husband's name?
questions.explanation:
Dick.

	Because Judy got divorced, she had to go back to work.

questions.text: Mr. Hart (Dabney Coleman) gave Violet (Lily Tomlin) money to buy his wife a present, and then turned around and gave the gift to Parton's character. What was the gift?
questions.explanation: Scarf.

questions.text: What was the name of the sugar substitute confused with 'Rid-O-Rat'?
questions.explanation:
'Skinny-n-Sweet'.

	After Violet accidently put the 'Rid-O-Rat' into the coffee, it began the hilarious hospital scenes where the three thought Mr. Hart had died.

questions.text: Dolly Parton's character was married. Was her husband ever seen in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	There was a scene with Doralee and her husband Dwayne. She was venting to him about how she felt that nobody at work liked her.

questions.text: What was the name of the bar where the three women hung out?
questions.explanation:
Charley's.

	The three ended up at Charley's after Doralee found out that her boss had been spreading rumors saying she was having an affair with him. Judy found out that an employee got fired, and Violet found out that she did not get a promotion because she was a woman. They had sorrows to drown.

questions.text: What was the name of 'the old lush' (the drunk)?
questions.explanation:
Margaret Foster.

	'Atta girl!'

questions.text: Who gave Violet the joint?
questions.explanation:
Her son.

	Her son gave Violet the joint to help her relax -- she was stressed because she found out that after she recommended color-coding to Mr. Hart, he turned around and claimed to the upper management that he came up with the idea himself.

questions.text: There was a scene where the three women were having an 'old-fashioned ladies' pot party.' Which actress refused to be filmed smoking a joint?
options: None -- all three were seen smoking the joint
questions.explanation:
Dolly Parton.

	Although the suggestion was that all three were sitting around smoking the joint, Parton was never shown actually smoking it.

questions.text: What does Judy call Mr. Hart during her fantasy?
questions.explanation:
'A sexist, egotistical, lying, hypocritical bigot.'

	This quote is from the sequence showing Judy's fantasy of being a bounty hunter, with Mr. Hart as her prey.

questions.text: Who was Violet in her fantasy?
questions.explanation:
Snow White.

	Violet ended up poisoning Mr. Hart in her fantasy, and ejected him from his office chair and out the window.

questions.text: Who threatened Mr. Hart that she would 'change him from a rooster to a hen with one shot' with her gun?
questions.explanation:
Parton's character.

	This comment from Doralee came right after she found out that the office staff thought she was having an affair with Hart.

questions.text: Which country was Roz sent to?
questions.explanation:
France.

	Roz was Mr. Hart's spy, so the three women sent her to France while Hart was being held hostage.

questions.text: What was wrong with Violet's car when the police officer pulled her over?
options: Her windows were tinted too dark.
Her brake lights were not working.
questions.explanation:
Her signal light kept blinking.

	Did you notice that when Violet drove away, the signal was turned off?

questions.text: Which one of Mr. Hart's credit cards did Parton's character use to buy the equipment to keep the boss tied up?
questions.explanation:
MasterCharge.

	Doralee signed Mr. Hart's name better than he did.

questions.text: How long did Violet have to wait to get the invoices from Mr. Hart's side business (Ajax Warehouse)?
questions.explanation: 4 to 6 weeks.

questions.text: What was the first thing Mr. Hart noticed missing after he returned back to work after being held hostage?
questions.explanation:
The time clock.

	There were many changes the three made to the company, most of which cut down absenteeism.

questions.text: When Mr. Tinsworthy (The Chairman of the Board) visited, what was one of the changes he did not agree with?
questions.explanation: Equal pay.

questions.text: Which country did Mr. Tinsworthy send Mr. Hart to?
questions.explanation:
Brazil.

	Mr. Tinsworthy offered Mr. Hart the 'opportunity of the lifetime' to go to Brazil for one of his operations.

questions.text: How much of an increase in productivity was there during Mr. Hart's absence?
questions.explanation:
20 percent in six weeks.

	Mr. Tinsworthy had to meet the person responsible for the increase in productivity. Even though the three women made all of the changes, Mr. Hart ended up getting the credit...however, this is how he ended up being sent to Brazil.

questions.text: Did Parton's character quit the company at the end of the movie (either in the on-screen action or in the text before the credits)?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	According to the ending credits, Doralee ended up quitting Consolidated and becoming a country and western singer.
